scripts.comment: Here is a little tutorial to recording moves, and how to combinate many moves together. Start by reading the comment block, and execute each block one per one. If you have questions just ask it on poppy forum : forum.poppy-project.org

block.comment: This will set the variable 'motors' to all avaible motors of your poppy creature. You can see 'motors' variable on the right of the screen.

custom-block.comment: This will make all motors not compliant, i.e. this will block all motors to their current position.
Here you defined a record move, called "my first record" to the motors head_z. These motors exist only if you use poppy humanoid. The recording last 5 seconds and stop.

scripts.comment: Now you will see how to record many motors at once.

custom-block.comment: You just have to click on the right arrow on the "create move ... with motor(s) ..." block and a new empty input will appear. You can add as many motors you want.
You can test your record. If you're not satisfied, you can execute the above block to record it again.

scripts.comment: You know how to record and replay a move. Let's play with nested records orchestration.

custom-block.comment: The two above records are now play one after the other.

This block is not specified to records. You can put in any reporter block and it will execute them sequentialy, one after the other. To add as many block as you want uin inputs, you have to click on the right arrow.
This will do the same thing than the "play sequentialy moves ..." above, but you can run reporter block between, before or after playing moves.

scripts.comment: In the same way of blocks "sequential ..." and "play sequentialy moves ...", there is a "concurent" and a "play concurently moves ..."

custom-block.comment: These two blocks have identical function, the two records are played in the same time.

scripts.comment: You can now mix concurent and sequential play.

custom-block.comment: Here, the second record will be play, and at the same time the first record and the second record will be play one after the orther.

scripts.comment: Bigger experiment and more miore complicated to read and understand. Don't feel silly if you don't undestand evrything, it is more a demonstration than a lesson. It will record each motor, one after another in separated move files. Each move filename is "move_" + name of the recorded motor. After that, you will be able to play sequentialy and concurently any moves combination.

block.comment: Its just playing a bip to warn you that the recording will stop

scripts.comment: All reports input are run concurently. You can use this block to play concurently many recorded move

custom-block.comment: This will play concurently the sequence of moves 4 and 5 of move_list and moves 1 to 3 of move_list

code.parms_list: Context >> a CommandBlockMorph ("script variables %scriptVars...") a VariableFrame {}
code.tempvars_delim: Context >> a CommandBlockMorph ("script variables %scriptVars...") a VariableFrame {}
code.doSetVar: Context >> a CommandBlockMorph ("script variables %scriptVars...") a VariableFrame {}

block-definition.comment: Return a list of motors which are grouped in the input alias
Return a list of all available motors
Return a list of all motors present positions, in the order of "$robot all motors" block list. Usefull for some advanced programs.
Get the present position (angle) of the defined <motor>

Get a defined <register> <value> of one motor. Example of some registers : torque_limit, angle_limit, present_temperature, present_position... For more informations about registers, look at the online documentation : http://$robot-project.github.io/pypot/
Return the index of a motor name in the "$robot all motors" block list
For internal use only

Compliance property make motors activly become soft and movable. You need to activate the compliance if you want to record a movement by demonstration. The motor(s) input can accept : - string of a motor name - string of many motors separed with spaces - a Snap! list of motors like the reporter block "$robot all motors"

set motor to the desired position (angle) in the desired time. The motor(s) input can accept : - string of a motor name - string of many motors separed with spaces - a Snap! list of motors like the reporter block "$robot all motors"
Reset the simulation in V-rep. It is usefull if you have connection issues with V-rep.

Record the movement to the desired motors. To start recording, <active> boolean input must be true, and it must be false to stop recording. Note : to stop recording, only the <record_name> input is important (motors don't matter) The <record_name> input is used to store the recorded move. The move is stored in the directory where you started the web server (with the command "$robot-snap $robot-ergo" for example), and can be replayed even if you close Snap! The motor(s) input can accept : - string of a motor name - string of many motors separed with spaces - a Snap! list of motors like the reporter block "$robot all motors"

block-definition.s: $robot play record %'record_name' at speed x %'speed' | wait to stop ? %'wait'
block-definition.comment: Play the movement of a previous recorded move. To start playing a record, check that motors are not in compliance mode. The <record_name> input is the name of a .record filename which should be in the same directory where you started the web server (with the command "$robot-snap $robot-ergo" for example). You can change the play speed with the <speed> input. The <wait_to_stop> boolean input can set be true to wait the end of movement

list.l: > is not is the avaible records :

block-definition.comment: Return a list of all previous records filename.
Take any number of input lists, and create a new list containing the items of the input lists. So APPEND [A B] [C D] where the [,,,] are lists reports the list [A B C D] not [[A B] [C D]].
Reports a new list containing the items of the input list, but in the opposite order.
Reports a new list whose items are the same as in the input list, except that if two or more equal items appear in the input list, only the last one is kept in the result.

Reports a sorted version of the list in its first input slot, using the comparison function in the second input slot. For a list of numbers, using < as the comparison function will sort from low to high; using > will sort from high to low.

Set a defined <value> to a defined <register> of one or many motors. Example of some registers : torque_limit, angle_limit, safe_compliant, compliant... For more informations about registers, look at the online documentation : http://$robot-project.github.io/pypot/ The motor(s) input can accept : - string of a motor name - string of many motors separed with spaces - a Snap! list of motors like the reporter block "$robot all motors"

Play the movement of a previous recorded move. The <record_name> input is the name of a .record filename which should be in the same directory where you started the web server (with the command "$robot-snap $robot-ergo" for example). You can change the play speed with the <speed> input.

block.comment: ugly wait to stop feature. TODO : change with a looking at running primitive

list.l: > is not is the avaible records (look at the block $robot all records to see all recorded moves)

block-definition.comment: All reports input are run concurently. You can use this block to play concurently many recorded move
Takes any number of numbers as inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports the result of adding them all, so ISUM (4) (100) (8)) reports 112.
Takes any number of numbers as inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports the result of multiplying them all, so (PRODUCT (4) (100) (8)) reports 3200.

Takes any number of Boolean (true/false) inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports TRUE only if all of the inputs are TRUE, otherwise FALSE. Like AND but for multiple inputs.
Takes any number of Boolean (true/false) inputs (use the left and right arrowheads to adjust the number of input slots) and reports TRUE if at least one input is TRUE, otherwise FALSE.
Start recording the desired move record. Be careful, you must have previously defined a move record with the "create move ... with motor(s) ..." block

custom-block.l: You must create a move before starting record

block-definition.comment: Define a move record with the desired motors. The <record_name> input is used to store the recorded move. The move is stored in the directory where you started the web server (with the command "$robot-snap $robot-ergo" for example), and can be replayed even if you close Snap! The motor(s) input can accept : - string of a motor name - string of many motors separed with spaces - a Snap! list of motors like the reporter block "$robot all motors" If the motor(s) input is empty, all motors will be recorded.

custom-block.l: Input error, you should look at help (right click on the bock)

list.l: is not in the aivaible motors of your robot :

block-definition.comment: Stop recording the desired move record. Be careful, you must have previously defined a move record with the "create move ... with motor(s) ..." block
Works as the map block (see map help), but it proceeds iterations concurently.
Play previous recorded move concurently. Inputs can be : * move name (string) * many moves name separated by whitespace * any reporter block, like sequential or play sequentialy

custom-block.l: Input is not valid. See help (right click on the block)

scripts.comment: TODO : understand why a sequential input blocks return items on a list rather than separated with whitespace

block-definition.comment: Play previous recorded moves sequentialy. Inputs can be : * move name (string) * many moves name separated by whitespace * any reporter block like concurent or play concurently

custom-block.l: Input is not valid. See help (right click on the block)

block-definition.comment: Return a list of all aliases. Alias is a keyword for representing many motors at once.
Return a sublist which contains items in the interval of 2 input numbers. Original list is not modified.

Play in reverse the movement of a previous recorded move. The <record_name> input is the name of a .record filename which should be in the same directory where you started the web server (with the command "$robot-snap $robot-ergo" for example). You can change the play speed with the <speed> input.

block.comment: ugly wait to stop feature. TODO : change with a looking at running primitive

list.l: > is not is the avaible records (look at the block $robot all records to see all recorded moves)
